title: Hong Kong police fire gun and use water cannon on protesters
description: Police fire a gun and deploy a water cannon to disperse crowds during a 12th week of protests.

title: Israel says it struck Iranian 'killer drone' sites in Syria
description: In a rare acknowledgement, PM Benjamin Netanyahu says Israeli forces targeted "killer drones".

title: Mallorca aircraft collide in mid-air, killing at least seven
description: Two of those killed when a helicopter and an ultralight plane collided were under 18.

title: Sharks and rays to be given new international protections
description: An estimated 100 million sharks are killed every year, many for shark fin soup.

title: Floods kill more than 60 in Sudan
description: Nearly 200,000 people have been affected by floods since the beginning of July.

title: Amazon fires: The devastation seen from above
description: Swathes of the Amazon rainforest in Brazil are burning at a record rate.

title: LA policeman who said sniper shot him 'made it up'
description: Deputy Angel Reinosa cut two bullet holes in his shirt and called in to say he was "taking shots".

title: Amazon fires: Fines for environmental crimes drop under Bolsonaro
description: The government is accused of ignoring illegal deforestation and burning in the Amazon.

title: Rohingya crisis: Rallies mark two years of exile in Bangladesh
description: Two years after what the UN calls ethnic cleansing, refugees from Myanmar mark their "genocide day".

title: Algeria culture minister quits after concert stampede
description: Five young fans of popular French-based rapper Soolking were killed in a stadium in Algiers.

title: Six hurt after lightning strike at golf tournament
description: Six people are injured as lightning strikes hit a tree at the season-ending Tour Championship in Atlanta.

title: South Africa seizes Air Tanzania plane in Johannesburg
description: A farmer claims the plane was impounded because Tanzania's government hasn't paid him compensation.

title: Changing places: Why countries decide to move their capitals
description: Indonesia is the latest country to embark on moving its capital city. Here are some other examples.

title: Is the US still Asia's only military superpower?
description: A report finds the US' defence strategy in the Indo-Pacific region is close to a crisis.

title: Imran Khan: A year facing Pakistan’s harsh realities
description: Pakistan's cricketer-turned-PM has had success abroad but struggled at home during a tough year in office.

title: 'There was no hope': Treatable disease often mistaken for Alzheimer's
description: Normal pressure hydrocephalus, which causes mobility and memory issues, can be mistaken for dementia.

title: Zimbabwe: Is it worse off than under former President Mugabe?
description: The opposition in Zimbabwe says things are worse than under former leader Robert Mugabe - it it right?

title: Instagram influencers: Have we stopped believing?
description: Instagrammer Tiffany Mitchell has been forced to deny faking a road crash for likes.

title: Why so many US 'mass shooting' arrests suddenly?
description: In the last three weeks, there have been 28 people arrested after threats of mass violence.

title: 'This is very scary': Greenlanders on Trump wanting to buy their island
description: He's not even talking to Greenland - he's talking to Denmark about buying Greenland.

title: The African American who moved to Ghana 'to escape US racism'
description: Ghana is encouraging African Americans to relocate to the country, which was at the heart of the slave trade.

title: Althea Gibson: The pioneering champion America forgot
description: Althea Gibson became the first black player to win a Grand Slam yet she received little recognition during her life. Why?

title: Hong Kong protests: Shot fired and water cannon used
description: Hong Kong police fired a gunshot during protests for the first time since demonstrations broke out.

title: 'The Paralympics and the Olympics should be less separate'
description: Paralympic long-jumper Markus Rehm wants to see a closer relationship between the Olympics and Paralympics.

title: Women hit back at 'slut-shaming'
description: High-profile women are hitting back following criticism of their clothing choices.

title: LA police officer 'fabricated' claims he was shot
description: Angel Reinosa said he'd been hit in the shoulder by a sniper. But now authorities say he made it up.

title: G7: Trump praises Johnson as 'right man' to deliver Brexit
description: Boris Johnson reacts as US President Trump praises the UK PM as the right man to deliver Brexit.

title: Han Sung-ok: Was this North Korean defector failed by the South?
description: The lonely death of Han Sung-ok and her son, possibly by starvation, has South Korea asking "if only"...

title: The mystery photos of a 1957 gay wedding
description: Who are the two grooms in these wedding photos? Filmmakers are trying to find out, 60 years later.

title: Khachaturyan sisters who killed father touch Russian hearts
description: The case of the teenage Khachaturyan sisters stirs Russian anger over domestic abuse.

title: Eduard Pernkopf: The Nazi book of anatomy still used by surgeons
description: Eduard Pernkopf created an "atlas" of anatomy by dissecting the bodies of Nazi political prisoners.

title: What is 'blobology' and how is it transforming biology?
description: Spectacular images from a new microscope spark a "revolution" in biology
